alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Carroll; Clinton; Daviess; De Kalb; Gentry; Grundy; Harrison; Livingston; Mercer; Ray; Worth (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:25AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Worth, Daviess, western Grundy, eastern Clinton, eastern Gentry, western Mercer, northern Ray, Harrison, northwestern Carroll, Caldwell, eastern DeKalb and western Livingston Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 325 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Irena to near Lathrop. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cameron, Trenton, Bethany, Hamilton, Gallatin, Braymer, Polo, Jamesport, Ridgeway, Breckenridge, Gilman City, Kingston, Pattonsburg, Eagleville, New Hampton, Cainsville, Utica, Cowgill, Kidder and Winston. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 37 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Carroll; Clinton; Daviess; De Kalb; Gentry; Grundy; Harrison; Livingston; Mercer; Ray; Worth
